uk.ac.ebi.gxa.dao
Class AtlasDAO

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.ebi.gxa.dao.AtlasDAO

public class AtlasDAO
extends Object

A data access object designed for retrieving common sorts of data from the atlas database. This DAO should be configured with a spring JdbcTemplate object which will be used to query the database.

Author:
Tony Burdett

getJdbcTemplate

public org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate getJdbcTemplate()

setJdbcTemplate

public void setJdbcTemplate(org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate template)

getMaxQueryParams

public int getMaxQueryParams()
Get the maximum allowed number of parameters that can be supplied to a parameterised query. This is effectively the maximum bound for an "IN" list - i.e. SELECT * FROM foo WHERE foo.bar IN (?,?,?,...,?). If unset, this defaults to 500. Typically, the limit for oracle databases is 1000. If, for any query that takes a list, the size of the list is greater than this value, the query will be split into several smaller subqueries and the results aggregated. As a user, you should not notice any difference.

Returns:
the maximum bound on the query list size

setMaxQueryParams

public void setMaxQueryParams(int maxQueryParams)
Set the maximum allowed number of parameters that can be supplied to a parameterised query. This is effectively the maximum bound for an "IN" list - i.e. SELECT * FROM foo WHERE foo.bar IN (?,?,?,...,?). If unset, this defaults to 500. Typically, the limit for oracle databases is 1000. If, for any query that takes a list, the size of the list is greater than this value, the query will be split into several smaller subqueries and the results aggregated.

Parameters:
maxQueryParams - the maximum bound on the query list size - this should never be greater than that allowed by the database, but can be smaller

getExperimentByAccession

public Experiment getExperimentByAccession(String accession)
Gets a single experiment from the Atlas Database, queried by the accession of the experiment.

Parameters:
accession - the experiment's accession number (usually in the format E-ABCD-1234)
Returns:
an object modelling this experiment

getAllGenes

public List<Gene> getAllGenes()
Fetches all genes in the database. Note that genes are not automatically prepopulated with property information, to keep query time down. If you require this data, you can fetch it for the list of genes you want to obtain properties for by calling getPropertiesForGenes(java.util.List). Genes are prepopulated with design element information, however.

Returns:
the list of all genes in the database

getAllGenesFast

public List<Gene> getAllGenesFast()
Same as getAllGenes(), but doesn't do design elements. Sometime we just don't need them.

Returns:
list of all genes

getGeneByIdentifier

public Gene getGeneByIdentifier(String identifier)

getGenesByExperimentAccession

public List<Gene> getGenesByExperimentAccession(String exptAccession)
Fetches all genes for the given experiment accession. Note that genes are not automatically prepopulated with property information, to keep query time down. If you require this data, you can fetch it for the list of genes you want to obtain properties for by calling getPropertiesForGenes(java.util.List). Genes are prepopulated with design element information, however.

Parameters:
exptAccession - the accession number of the experiment to query for
Returns:
the list of all genes in the database for this experiment accession

getPropertiesForGenes

public void getPropertiesForGenes(List<Gene> genes)

getGeneCount

public int getGeneCount()

getAllAssays

public List<Assay> getAllAssays()
Gets all assays in the database. Note that, unlike other queries for assays, this query does not prepopulate all property information. This is done to keep the query time don to a minimum. If you need this information, you should populate it by calling getPropertiesForAssays(java.util.List) on the list (or sublist) of assays you wish to fetch properties for. Bear in mind that doing this for a very large list of assays will result in a slow query.

Returns:
the list of all assays in the database

getAllArrayDesigns

public List<ArrayDesign> getAllArrayDesigns()
Returns all array designs in the underlying datasource. Note that, to reduce query times, this method does NOT prepopulate ArrayDesigns with their associated design elements (unlike other methods to retrieve array designs more specifically). For this reason, you should always ensure that after calling this method you use the getDesignElementsForArrayDesigns(java.util.List) method on the resulting list.

Returns:
the list of array designs, not prepopulated with design elements.

getArrayDesignByAccession

public ArrayDesign getArrayDesignByAccession(String accession)

getArrayDesignByExperimentAccession

public List<ArrayDesign> getArrayDesignByExperimentAccession(String exptAccession)

getDesignElementsForArrayDesigns

public void getDesignElementsForArrayDesigns(List<ArrayDesign> arrayDesigns)

getDesignElementsByArrayAccession

public Map<Integer,String> getDesignElementsByArrayAccession(String arrayDesignAccession)
A convenience method that fetches the set of design elements by array design accession. Design elements are recorded as a map, indexed by design element id and with a value of the design element accession. The set of design element ids contains no duplicates, and the results that are returned are the internal database ids for design elements. This takes the accession of the array design as a parameter.

Parameters:
arrayDesignAccession - the accession number of the array design to query for
Returns:
the map of design element accessions indexed by unique design element id integers

getDesignElementNamesByArrayAccession

public Map<Integer,String> getDesignElementNamesByArrayAccession(String arrayDesignAccession)
A convenience method that fetches the set of design elements by array design accession. In this case, design elements are recorded as a map, indexed by design element id and with a value of the design element name. The design element name corresponds to the arraydesign reporter name or composite reporter name, and is usually the probeset ID. The set of design element ids contains no duplicates, and the results that are returned are the names for design elements. This takes the accession of the array design as a parameter.

Parameters:
arrayDesignAccession - the accession number of the array design to query for
Returns:
the map of design element names indexed by unique design element id integers

writeExpressionAnalytics

public void writeExpressionAnalytics(String experimentAccession,
                                     String property,
                                     String propertyValue,
                                     int[] designElements,
                                     double[] pValues,
                                     double[] tStatistics)
Writes expression analytics data back to the database, after post-processing by an external analytics process. Expression analytics consist of p-values and t-statistics for each design element, annotated with a property and property value. As such, for each annotated design element there should be unique analytics data for each annotation.

Parameters:
experimentAccession - the accession of the experiment these analytics values belong to
property - the name of the property for this set of analytics
propertyValue - the property value for this set of analytics
designElements - an array of ints, representing the design element ids for this analytics 'bundle'
pValues - an array of doubles, indexed in the same order as design elements, capturing the pValues in the context of this property/property value pair
tStatistics - an array of doubles, indexed in the same order as design elements, capturing the tStatistic (a double) in the context of this property/property value pair

writeArrayDesignBundle

public void writeArrayDesignBundle(ArrayDesignBundle arrayDesignBundle)
Writes array designs and associated data back to the database.

Parameters:
arrayDesignBundle - an object encapsulating the array design data that must be written to the database

deleteExperiment

public void deleteExperiment(String experimentAccession)
Deletes the experiment with the given accession from the database. If this experiment is not present, this does nothing.

Parameters:
experimentAccession - the accession of the experiment to remove
